nodes.bodyText:
Seems odd/redundant that this needs to be done in script.
It is more "Maveny" to configure this in the Maven exec plugin and the plugin should fail if this script exits non-zero.
https://www.mojohaus.org/exec-maven-plugin/exec-mojo.html#successCodes
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,4 +3,10 @@ set -o errexit
 set -o pipefail
 set -o nounset
 # https://github.com/mikefarah/yq Require version 3.1.2.  Newer version will likely also work.
-yq r --tojson src/main/resources/openapi3/unsortedopenapi.yaml | yq r - -P > src/main/resources/openapi3/openapi.yaml
+yq r --tojson src/main/resources/openapi3/unsortedopenapi.yaml | yq r - -P > src/main/resources/openapi3/openapi.yaml || {

nodes.bodyText:

nodes.bodyText: I was under the impression no, it seemed like Maven got past it in https://oicr.slack.com/archives/C16ET3CF4/p1591799974401000 but maybe there is something special about that environment?
